refnamediv.refpurpose: Script to delete a Kirby vhost

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page documents briefly the &dhpackage; command, which is part of the kirbytools1 package.

&dhpackage; is a script that will deinstall a Kirby virtual host. Multiple virtual hosts can be deinstalled at once by supplying a wildcard expression for the virtual host name. However, you have to confirm the deinstallation of every single virtual host.
Optionally, you can remove the virtual host configuration file(s) as well. Confirmation must be given to every file.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The script follows the usual GNU command line syntax, options always starting with a dash (`-').

listitem.para: Specify the name of the virtual host to deinstall. You can easiliy find any given virtual host by using bash's tab completion functionality. Hitting <tab> once will complete the name if it is unambiguous. Hitting <tab> twice will show all possible completions.

It is possible to use wildcards here. Hence using kirby-* will deinstall all Kirby virtual hosts which have been created with the kirbytools1 package (supposed you did not change the default value for $KIRBYSUFFIX).
The system-wide configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;.
The per-user configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;. This file will be created by the kirbyconfigure script (see kirbyconfigure1) if it does not exist.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: Currently, only Kirby 3 starterkits and plainkits are supported.
The programs are currently limited to work with the apache2 httpd.
Some functionality requires root (or sudo as root) access.
